intro: Siphonanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved siphonanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, shrub-like plant with narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is characterized by its simple, branching structure and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Siphonanthus angustifolius is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
